anathema: Command a subordinate to perform a task you’re not willing to perform yourself
edict: Act with conviction and confidence, be a passionate and responsible leader to your people or companions
markdown:
<title level="1" right="Deity " pfs="Restricted">[Sturovenen (The Dragoneagle)](/Deities.aspx?ID=523)</title>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<traits>

</traits>

**Source** [Divine Mysteries](/Sources.aspx?ID=234) pg. 314

Sturovenen was born to the second generation of spirit guides, the mighty son of [Dragon](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=395) and [Eagle](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=406). Noble, kind, and a leader by example, Sturovenen’s worship spread quickly and he ascended to full godhood in astonishingly short order. Sturovenen had two great loves: the mortal man Chakli, who became Sturovenen’s first god caller, and the spirit guide Canary. 

Sturovenen and Chakli founded the Neverhome Clan together and made it a refuge for those with no clan of their own and nowhere else to seek shelter. Though Chakli’s life was short even by mortal standards, he lived to choose an heir who became Sturovenen’s next god caller and that tradition carried on generation after generation. It became a teaching among Sturovenen’s god callers that they had a responsibility to the Dragoneagle to ensure that he never lacked a mortal companion to preach wisdom and patience, for Sturovenen’s selflessness was well-known and an ancient prophecy spoken by the spirit guide Fox foretold that the very traits which made the Dragoneagle so well-loved would one day be his undoing. The god callers shared the duty of looking out for Sturovenen with his dawn-feathered children, the offspring of Sturovenen and Canary, many of whom took on god callers of their own and became quite famous among the people of Sarkoris outside of their father’s great shadow.

Sadly, Fox’s foretelling proved correct when the Godsrain struck Sarkoris. With the walls between planes already thin and damaged, [demonic](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=387) hordes sought to reopen the Worldwound and Sturovenen, accompanied by his last god caller and his many dawn-feathered children, flew to the nation’s defense. Sturovenen ultimately gave his life, snatching a corrupted warshard from demonic claws and purifying it in a rainbow explosion that also seems to have erased his own existence.

<column gap="tiny">

**Category** [Dead or Missing Deities](/DeityCategories.aspx?ID=34)

**Edicts** Act with conviction and confidence, be a passionate and responsible leader to your people or companions

**Anathema** Command a subordinate to perform a task you’re not willing to perform yourself

**Area of Concern**
Leadership, righteous battle, the sun

</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
<title level="2">Devotee Benefits</title>

<column gap="tiny">

**[Divine Attribute](/Backgrounds.aspx?ID=132)**
Dexterity or Charisma

**Divine Font** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148)

**Divine Sanctification** can choose holy

**Divine Skill** [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39)

**Favored Weapon** [Main-gauche](/Weapons.aspx?ID=387)

**Domains** [Air](/Domains.aspx?ID=65), [Confidence](/Domains.aspx?ID=67), [Passion](/Domains.aspx?ID=88), [Sun](/Domains.aspx?ID=92)

**[Alternate Domains](/Rules.aspx?ID=802)** [Dragon](/Domains.aspx?ID=106), [Zeal](/Domains.aspx?ID=100)

**Cleric Spells**

- **1st**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=1463)

- **3rd**
[Wall of Radiance](/Spells.aspx?ID=2372)

- **5th**
[Cloak of Colors](/Spells.aspx?ID=1977)

</column>
name: Sturovenen (The Dragoneagle)
